rdf:Description.dc:title: Consolidated financial statements of the Government of Alberta annual report 2007
rdf:Description.dc:creator: Alberta.
rdf:Description.dc:description: " ... report to Albertans on Budget ..., Strengthening today, securing tomorrow. ... permanent public record of all the dollars spent and the results achieved by the government of Alberta for the ... fiscal year."
Prepared by the Minister of Finance in accordance with the Government Accountability Act.

The Government of Alberta annual report consists of two parts: Measuring up which reports on the progress that has been made towards achieving the government's goals and Consolidated financial statements published in separate documents.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Government spending policy
Government productivity
